Halliburton, Baker Hughes and SLB reported aggregate net income of $4.4bn in 2022, the highest combined figure since 2014, as the war in Ukraine exacerbated fears over fuel shortages and triggered a rush to boost oil and gas production.  Olivier Le Peuch, chief executive of SLB — previously known as Schlumberger —  described 2022 as a “pivotal” year for the energy industry, which he said had entered the “early phase of a structural upcycle”.
